channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Authorities are warning Australians not to take part in Black Lives Matter rallies planned across the country on Saturday, saying the risk of coronavirus spreading is too great.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 6.6 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: This lesser discussed form of abuse can sometimes be difficult to spot, and it can leave people financially devastated.
item.title: After the divorce, Amanda learnt her ex's salary. His lying crippled her

item.description: The unemployment rate in pandemic-hit America remains the worst since World War II.
item.title: US unemployment rate falls as job losses ease

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: For economists, the unemployment numbers were a shock. For Trump, they were a political aphrodisiac.
item.title: Giddy with delight, Trump stages a victory lap over shock jobs figures

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: ME Bank has always strived for national recognition. But not of this sort.
item.title: Jamie McPhee and the 'Bank for Me'

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: The outgoing chief commissioner is "very proud" of the Victoria Police force, but if you are going to grill him beware - he has a secret identity.
item.title: The story of Graham Ashton: Where there's smoke there's fire

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: "It’s the idea of something wholesome but mindful and productive."
item.title: The unlikely generation driving the rise of knitting

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Australians should not be smug watching America's pandemonium. We have signs of the same dysfunction.
item.title: Let's not copy a broken empire

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Nine Entertainment Co chief executive Hugh Marks has accused Google of downplaying its stranglehold over the news industry
item.title: 'Not the point': Nine CEO Hugh Marks fires back at Google over $10m news claims

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Long-time sports administrator Sam Coffa has been enlisted to help restore the reputation of the Olympic sport after an investigation uncovered drug test cover-ups and vote buying.
item.title: ‘Tyranny of cash’: Australian vows to clean up weightlifting

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Other top candidates who could be considered for the role include Nick Weeks, Andrew Fagan, Andy Marinos and David Begg.
item.title: Kearns, Gallop among names in frame for rugby hot seat

item.dc:creator: George Megalogenis
item.description: The temptation is there for Morrison to show up Turnbull, the most socially progressive Liberal since Malcolm Fraser.
item.title: Why Morrison might be tempted to move on reconciliation: one-upmanship

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: If the federal government had goodwill towards universities, JobKeeper could have been made available to them. Liberal Senator James Paterson says there is little to none.
item.title: Universities count their losses, government sharpens its claws

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: In the past 10 years the number of Aboriginal people charged by police in NSW has increased by more than 67 per cent. For non-Indigenous Australians, the increase has been just 8 per cent.
item.title: Criminal justice system 'inherently racist' towards Aboriginal people

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: Thousands of businesses are being denied insurance claims but it isn't clear cut with a test case looming.
item.title: Insurers deny business insurance claims as battle begins

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, June 6

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: The reputation of Rio Tinto has taken a battering over the destruction of Juukan Gorge in the Pilbara. But how did it happen?
item.title: 'Incomprehensible': How Rio Tinto reduced 46,000 years of history to rubble

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Billions of dollars in water licences and infrastructure in the Murray-Darling Basin hinge on complex and opaque rules that vary greatly between rivers, researchers have found.
item.title: Clouds become water entitlements in ad hoc river plan, paper finds

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: Australia has never looked more attractive to Hollywood as a place to make film and TV, but there's a risk of missing the chance to capitalise on that interest.
item.title: Australia could be poised for boom in Hollywood production, says Ausfilm boss

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: Cromwell was until recently a boring property trust that owned rather unglamorous properties in Canberra with government tenants. But it's now growing very suspicious about its Chinese-backed Singapore investors.
item.title: The Chinese property billionaire eyeing Cromwell, the owner of sensitive Canberra assets

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: No lane-Nazis, no frantic overtakers ... soon I’m thinking we should have pandemics more often.
item.title: Take a number: the rules of synchronised, socially distanced swimming

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Seven local universities are in the world's top 100. But the drop in overseas student fees means the sector needs major reform if Australia wants them to stay there.
item.title: 'It gets ugly': Universities brace for major reform to save research

item.description: When the state turns on its own citizens using police or military force, we are on the way to totalitarianism.
item.title: Sorry state of original Australians laid bare

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: One senior MP said there was no appetite for change, particularly to payroll tax, with state budgets already under strain.
item.title: Payroll tax, stamp duty reform hopes dashed by federal government

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: Local agri-business group Fox & Lillie is so keen to get a tenant into its vacant second floor at 166 Albert Road that matchmakers have been called in.
item.title: Lakeside office with views looks for suitable match

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: Cornel Ozies has made a film about a new approach to policing in a remote outback community.
item.title: After his own troubling run-ins with police, Indigenous director offers hope with documentary

item.dc:creator: Stan Grant
item.description: Justice cannot be colour-blind, but we are not America and our streets, thankfully, are not battlegrounds.
item.title: When I look at America torn apart, I see my own family and Australia's history of racism

item.description: Designed by architect Charles D’Ebro and built in 1908, Collins House still proudly retains its heritage-listed facade.
item.title: Heritage gem emerges from the rubble

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Regional hotels will pave the way for the hard-hit sector's recovery from the devastating impact of COVID-19 with many opening their doors to new-look guest experiences.
item.title: Regional hotels lead sector's recovery but ditch 'home away from home' slogans

item.description: After much hesitation, the time has come for me to tentatively set foot in the pub once more.
item.title: Making the most of a 90-minute seating is thirsty work

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: Nine months ago Michael Yabsley finally admitted the truth he had long denied to himself and is family: he was gay.
item.title: 'I lived with a lot of denial': former politician Michael Yabsley's new life

item.description: Nine months ago Yabsley finally admitted the truth he had long denied to himself and is family: he was gay.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Former politician Michael Yabsley's new life

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: The country's top universities say the sector needs to be reformed, but smaller universities argue that will come at their expense.
item.title: 'All over red rover': Top unis drive biggest overhaul in 30 years

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Australian Industry Group urges the government to end the "better off" test, simplify awards and scrap criminal penalties for wage theft.
item.title: Business group lays out its wish list of reforms

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Uncle Jack Charles won't be at Saturday's Black Lives Matter rally, noting he needs to look after himself in order to pursue the long game of justice for Aboriginal youth.
item.title: Elders lend voice to project linking Fitzroy's Indigenous past and present

item.dc:creator: Danny Katz
item.description: Not a micro-celebrity, or even a mega-celebrity. I want to be an insta-celebrity.
item.title: I wanna be a celebrity, a regular household name

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Two months ago, with coronavirus lockdown looming, the NGV sprang into action. Their mission: to save this year's huge Triennial exhibition from cancellation.
item.title: 'We thought three years of work was down the drain': how NGV saved the show

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: The refund to more than 400,000 Australians who were chased over Centrelink debts won't stop a class action against the government.
item.title: $721 million robo-debt refund must be sped up, lawyers say

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Universities face losing billions in revenue from the loss of international students, and experts say it will have consequences for Australian research.
item.title: Bursting the foreign student bubble set to hobble Australian research

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The King Tutankhamun blockbuster that prompted the Australian Museum's $57 million renovation has been postponed with no future date set.
item.title: Curse of the Pharaoh: Sydney's summer of blockbusters is over

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: The Yarra River will be polluted with stormwater containing potentially toxic chemicals running off the $16 billion North East Link unless action is taken.
item.title: North East Link to pollute Yarra River with megalitres of stormwater runoff

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: 'It's like a ghost town': Some of the small number of Melbourne Airport passengers say where they are off to
item.title: Is anyone flying? Melbourne Airport passenger numbers at record low

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Inter-school sports are on hold indefinitely, but "virtual cross country" has gone gangbusters, with thousands of sport-starved students joining in last week.
item.title: 'Virtual cross country' races take off amid inter-school sports ban

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 6, 2020

item.description: The week in photos from award-winning Sydney Morning Herald photographers.
item.title: Photos of the week

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Michael Harry
item.description: How to keep a fine diner afloat during a pandemic? The No. 1 rule is to stay positive – and cooking a great lasagne helps as well.
item.title: From degustation to delivering lasagnes: how Ben Shewry crash-tackled a crisis

item.dc:creator: Jill Dupleix
item.description: There have been plenty of bite-sized upsides to the lockdown – new skills, fresh loves and a greater appreciation of the need for treats, big and small.
item.title: The big takeaway: food wins from the pandemic

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Melbourne Storm's defence was back to its match-winning best as they held off the South Sydney Rabbitohs last night.
item.title: Rabbit-proof defence: Storm deny Souths again
